subject: From Mrs. Tantiana Borisma.
body:
From Mrs. Tantiana Borisma.
I know that this letter may come to you as a surprise, I came across
your email contact from my personal search and I decided to reveal
this lifetime secret to you as I prayed hard before I sent you this
email. I believe that you will be honest and sincere to fulfill my
final wish before I die. I am Tantiana Borisma, from (Kuwait), but I
work in (Lhasa) Ivory Coast. I am 54 years old now, and a business
woman dealing with gold exportation, for the past eight years, but
have been suffering from breast cancer for a long time From all
indications my condition is really deteriorating, and my doctors have
courageously advised that I may not live beyond the next one year,
because the cancer has reached a critical stage. I have only one
daughter who's 16 years old. My husband died in a fatal motor accident
some years back, and I decided not to re- marry because of my bad
health. Before the death of my husband, he deposited the sum of
$55,500,000 million dollar in the bank,
I want you to assist me in order to claim the fund from the bank, as
my husband's foreign business partner. After you have received the
Fund to your account in your country, you will then adopt my only
daughter to your country for continuation of her education. Keep 20%
of the money for yourself for your help to my only daughter and invest
the rest of the money in my daughter's name. I believe that you will
be in a better position to help me claim the Fund from the Bank. As
soon as I receive your reply I shall give you the contact of the Bank
where the Fund is deposited, AS MY FAMILY'S NEXT OF KIN. Please assure
me that you will act accordingly as I stated here. If you are
interested, kindly reply immediately so I will Swear an Affidavit in
your name as my family's only appointed Beneficiary/Next of Kin, to
this fund through my family's lawyer, Barr. O. Agbakoba, Email:
(
justicechambers@mail.ee
) You can contact the chambers for
clarifications.
Hope to hear from you soonest.
Mrs. Tantiana Borisma

subject: Re:   From Mrs. Tantiana Borisma.
body:
Hello Mrs. Tantiana Borisma,

I'm really sorry to hear about your health condition and the challenges you're facing. It's a lot for anyone to handle. I can't imagine how tough it must be for you and your daughter.

Your story is quite touching, and I appreciate your trust in sharing such personal information with me. However, I have a few questions that I hope you won't mind answering.

Firstly, could you please tell me more about your business? How did you get into the gold business? 

Secondly, could you provide more details about the bank where the fund is deposited? What's the name of the bank and where is it located?

Lastly, could you tell me more about your daughter? What are her interests and what does she want to study?

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Louise
